page.title: 17DISTINGTON EAST COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: In this section of the block you can walk a very long way before finding a house.There are many fields of grass,supporting cattle and sheep.Some fields,and allthe tracks and roadsides are rich in wild flowers.There are also irregular patches of woodland.Dismantled railway lines wander and converge here,as throughout the Distington block. In contrast with the fields,some slag banks stand high in the bottom ofthe slight valley.There are remains from a past ironworks,and part of this waste area is now used as a refuse tip.
